channel.title: Posts on R-Ladies East Lansing
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on R-Ladies East Lansing

item.title: R-Ladies East Lansing
item.description: On a cool Monday evening in late July almost 40 women (and a few brave men) gathered at Michigan State University’s campus to kickoff the R-Ladies East Lansing Chapter. The group included women in industry and academia who were using the R-language (or planning to use it) for a variety of applications including computer science, human health, earth sciences, political science, statistics and finance. Over pizza and pop the group warmed up with introductions and engaged in discussions about their R-interests.

item.title: Lightning Talks
Lightning Talks
item.description: We had such an amazing line up of talks! Morphospaces w/ #Geomorph by Acacia Ackles Integrating Python & R w/ #Reticulate by Anna Yannakopoulos Literature Survey w/ #Bibliometrix by Veronica Frans GLM w/ #glmulti by Lauren Wisnieski Cool #dataviz resources Data-to-Viz RGraph Gallery by Janani Ravi ðŸ’°Special thanks to College Of Veterinary Medicine [@MSUVets](https://twitter.com/MSUVets) Michigan State University Hosts: Janani Ravi & Camille Archer

item.title: Lightning Talks
item.description: A great set of talks to conlude our lightning talk series! Spatial Humanities w/ R Rachael White R/qtl Miranda Haus Hyenas, Microbes & R Connie Rojas Publication quality figures w/ #ggpubr by Taylor Dunivin R+LaTeX=knitr Cara Feldscher ðŸ’°Thank you Krishnan Lab[ @KrishnanLab](https://twitter.com/KrishnanLab) CMSE BMB, Michigan State University Hosts: Janani Ravi & Camille Archer
